Today in 2013 it is not the same. The majorty GOP in 2013 can and may vote no on the debt ceiling and send our credit rating to the toilet. They don't care. Message.Title: Fitch To Tea Party Controlled House Of Reps: Increase the debt limit or lose top credit rating.
Message.Msg: LONDON (AP) — The United States could lose its top credit rating for the second time from a leading credit agency if there's a delay in raising the country's debt ceiling, Fitch Ratings warned Tuesday. Congress has to increase the country's debt limit, which effectively rules how much debt the U.S. can have, by March 1 or face a potential default. ************************************************************************************************* Obama doesn't approve the budget. That's the House's job via the Constitution. The House already approved the spending. The House already racked up the bills. Message.Title: W8 phone & Nokia are now set to caputure the developing countries untapped market.
Message.Msg: Nokia and Microsoft have a partnership. The new Nokia 620 has all the bells and whistles of the raved 920. Of course it everything is not the same as the 920 inside. However, there has been a whole that all phone companies ignored. The developing countries who Apple just stuck there nose up in the air and ignored developing countries. Alot of people (not all) that can afford phones are still using old dumb flip phones. Now the 620 will be available with the live tile w8 experience, camera, voice assisted navigation and free apps. It will be the greatest thing they have ever seen. The phone is in the $250.00 range rather than the $500.00 - $800.00 of most smart phones. In developing countries there are a lot of customers that do not have cell phones. This is a huge market that has been waiting for a smart phone like w8. Nokia is very popular overseas.

Topic.Title: Bing?

Message.Msg: Haven't really checked to see if it's faster or not. By the time the page loads the search is always finished, so speed isn't really a factor for me. But under utilization doesn't make it cheaper. It makes it lose a couple $billion a year. Until 2012 that is. They just wrote off $6.5 billion for the last quarter of fiscal 2012. Online Services Division has lost $13.8 billion since Bing started in 2009. Yes, search income is up but display ad income is down. So will they take a loss on this to get more business? And will they try to make it up on volume?
